{"step_by_step_thinking": "Primary prevention refers to measures taken to prevent the onset of illness before the disease process begins. Secondary prevention refers to measures that lead to early diagnosis and prompt treatment of a disease, illness or injury to prevent more severe problems developing. Tertiary prevention refers to measures aimed at rehabilitation following significant illness. Primordial prevention involves the measures taken to prevent the risk factors themselves, usually lifestyle and social changes. In this case, the prevention of any incipient lesion at the initial stage is aimed at preventing the onset of illness before the disease process begins, which aligns with the definition of primary prevention.", "answer_choice": "A"}
